shops.preamble: Gob's Shop is located in [Ta'Illistim, Mzaarine Bazaar] at a simple shop, and is currently open for business.

items.name: a black-eyed skull-shaped jar containing n'ayanad crystals

raw: It is estimated that a black-eyed skull-shaped jar containing n'ayanad crystals can store a very small amount with enough space for one item.
The jar can not be worn.
Analysis of a black-eyed skull-shaped jar containing n'ayanad crystals indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This skull-shaped jar is designed to hold small, nearly identical items -- in particular, gems, alchemy ingredients other than critter skins, etc.
Alterations are permitted to the base description following the 15/15/15 rule in ALTER 2, provided that it continues to make sense that the contents would be identifiable without looking inside.
It can hold a maximum of 100 items.  PUT items in to store them.  SHAKE the jar to get them back out.
The skull-shaped jar will cost 10,000,000 coins.

items.name: a twilight blue and black aegis

raw: The natural blue and black swirls of mithglin are further embellished by a sprinkling of white gem dust.  These specks sparkle when they catch light and make up a nearly perfect twinkling imitation of the night's sky under the sign of the Unicorn.  In place of each star of the Unicorn constellation rests an intact diamond which boldy stands apart against the sea of gem dust.
The aegis is a large shield that protects the bearer if carried in the left hand.
Analysis of a twilight blue and black aegis indicates the item is flagged as Alteration Fodder.
The blue and black aegis will cost 1,000,000 coins.

sign: Written on a large sign:
WEAPONS and ARMOR

raw: The angular mithril puzzlebox has a square base with four, equidistant triangular sides that meet at its apex.  Each of the sides has a tiny dial in its center, surrounded by intricately detailed scrollwork and filigree.
It is estimated that a tiny angular mithril puzzlebox can store a small amount with enough space for one item.
The puzzlebox can not be worn.
Analysis of a tiny angular mithril puzzlebox indicates the creator has provided the following information:
Pondering Puzzlebox
Available Actions
SPIN - ask it a question then give it a spin!
FLIP, PULL, PUSH, TURN, and TWIST  (used to solve the puzzle)
This puzzlebox has a special way to open it using the dials on its sides.
Once open, you can reset the puzzle by closing it or spinning it.
If you make a mistake, the puzzle may magically reconfigure its dials to random positions.
Side-1 dial: tiny amethyst-eyed skull
(this must always be a tiny "skull" of some kind)
Side-2 dial: notched rainbow glaes
(usually a gemstone or symbol)
Side-3 dial: short bone wand
(usually an arrowhead or other tiny, pointed object)
Side-4 dial: yellowed troll tooth
(usually a carved piece of bone, horn, wood, etc.)
This puzzlebox can not be lightened or deepened.
The angular mithril puzzlebox will cost 1,000,000 coins.

items.name: a vaalin-rimmed glass bottle containing blue poppies

raw: It is estimated that a vaalin-rimmed glass bottle containing blue poppies can store a very small amount with enough space for one item.
The bottle can not be worn.
Analysis of a vaalin-rimmed glass bottle containing blue poppies indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This glass bottle is designed to hold small, nearly identical items -- in particular, gems, alchemy ingredients other than critter skins, etc.
Alterations are permitted to the base description following the 15/15/15 rule in ALTER 2, provided that it continues to make sense that the contents would be identifiable without looking inside.
It can hold a maximum of 20 items.  PUT items in to store them.  SHAKE the bottle to get them back out.
The glass bottle will cost 100,000 coins.

items.name: a pair of grey leather boots with folded rivet-edged cuffs

raw: Analysis of a pair of grey leather boots with folded rivet-edged cuffs indicates the creator has provided the following information:

You carefully analyze your grey leather boots and sense that there are some alteration restrictions.  Your boots must remain some kind of boots, slippers, shoes, or sandals.  You can change the article (the first 15), but it will carry forward to all variants of the boots, even after unlocking. IE: if you make it "an old white shirt", then it will always be "old".  No shows; long descriptions are okay as long as the additional description falls after the noun.
You may not change the color.  You may not change the material.  You can alter the "extra" (the description after the noun.)
This is currently Tier 2 and has the following verbs available:
CLEAN, PINCH, PULL, RUB, THUMP, PUSH, TICKLE, CLENCH, RAISE
Your boots can only be unlocked by Toffit or an official apprentice.
For information about colors and materials available at each Tier, THUMP boots.
The grey leather boots will cost 250,000 coins.

items.name: some grey elesine sandals with twisted indigo suede ties

raw: While the crisscrossing main straps, heel risers, and heel leashes of the sandals are made of lustrous light grey elesine, the soles and footbed are a dull-finished pewter leather.  Woven along the strips of elesine of the upper straps and heel leash are thin cords of indigo suede that extend beyond the base structure of the sandal to serve as ties.  The dye work on the suede is inconsistent, ranging from light blue to dark and back again, like the moonlight-dappled waves of a nighttime sea.
It is estimated that some grey elesine sandals with twisted indigo suede ties can store a very small amount with enough space for one item of very small size.
You can tell that the sandals are as light as they can get, but you might be able to have a talented merchant deepen their pockets for you.
The grey elesine sandals will cost 100,000 coins.

items.name: a milky white fennec fox fur stole with pert coffee-tipped ears

raw: Analysis of a milky white fennec fox fur stole with pert coffee-tipped ears indicates the creator has provided the following information:

The fennec fox stole can be altered with either a LONG or SHOW description.  It MUST remain as a singular, whole animal that has been preserved.  The messaging references eyes, legs, and a soft tail.  The adjective (middle 15 of the 15/15/15) MUST be the name of the animal in question.
Example:  "snow hare" or "russet fox"
It is fully unlocked and will haunt the wearer.  You can also CLEAN, RUB, SLAP, PLUCK, PUSH, PULL, SHAKE, and ATTEND the stole.
The fennec fox stole will cost 1,000,000 coins.

items.name: a corroded bronze pendant of tiny intertwined limbs

raw: Analysis of a corroded bronze pendant of tiny intertwined limbs indicates the item has certain alteration restrictions.  This material cannot be dyed.
The item has Flourishes that do the following:
This is an EzScripted item.  Some alteration restrictions may apply.  It has the following messaging:
turn
1st Person: You manage to stifle a yawn, then lift your bronze pendant for an up-close examination.  It's something to do.
3rd Person: Brodega appears to stifle a yawn, then lifts his bronze pendant and engages in an overly deliberate examination of it.
pull
1st Person: Absently, you grasp your bronze pendant and lift it so the chain is taut, then idly pluck at the chain with your index finger.
3rd Person: Looking less than attentive, Brodega lifts his bronze pendant so its chain is taut, then plucks idly at the chain with his index finger.
If there is a typo in the above messaging, please ASSIST and request a referral to speak to a GameMaster to fix it.  DO NOT BUG or BUGITEM the pendant!
The bronze pendant will cost 250,000 coins.

Analysis of an icy snowflake-filled jar indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is a prize token that, once REDEEMed, will:

Grant a custom Blink (1215) of icy snowflakes.  At this time, redemption of this customization will permanently disable default messaging of this spell.  Please remember you must be able to cast this spell on your own in order to use the customization and that this filled jar does not grant you the spell.
First Person:

A momentary eruption of icy snowflakes engulf you, filling your vision with a nearly blinding white light.  As the frosty blizzard dissipates, double images of the world sway dizzyingly around you before regaining solidity.
Effect Ending:  Briefly chilling your skin, hoarfrost spreads like a blue plague across every inch of your body, but soon melts and evaporates from the heat of your flesh.
Third Person:

A momentary eruption of icy snowflakes emanate from Brodega's hand and engulf him, frenzied snowflakes swirl about Brodega, obscuring his form in a wintery blizzard of blinding white.  As the frosty tendrils dissipate, double images of Brodega shiver slowly together into solidity.
Effect Ending:  A sudden chill fills the air as hoarfrost spreads like a blue plague across Brodega's skin.  It soon melts and then evaporates from the heat of his flesh.
Important note:
The effect of this token is cosmetic.  It does not increase the effect or damage caused by a spell.

This item does NOT grant spell knowledge.  REDEEMing this item assumes that the player already has the ability to cast the customized spell either from an item, Spell Knowledge, or having the spell cast upon you, if applicable.
The filled jar will cost 200,000 coins.

Indigo-hued blown glass forms the pot-belled bottom of the bottle, its bubbled opaqueness driven through with silvery whorls that resemble swirling mist.  A filigreed sheath, fitted over the neck of the piece, lays flat against the glass and bears an overlapping pattern of cockatoo feathers.  Sinuous and almost serpentine, a chain dangles a disk that is etched with a chelioboros within which is a small missive.
There appears to be something written on it.

~*~ Ezreshi Dreams - Caligos Isle 5117 ~*~

Analysis of an indigo blown glass bottle indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This bottle is for perfume or cologne.  Current verbs are: DRINK, MEASURE, POUR, and SMELL.
When applied, this bottle will produce the following scent.

First-person: You have an acrid bite of sea salt dancing across your skin that is enlivened by a base note of teak, with its crisp, woodsy and somewhat soapy scent.  Floral airs play across the light mixture, their fruity underlying aroma reminiscent of sweet plumeria and pungent ginger, while the refined and warm blend of lemon finishes the misty fragrance.

Third-person: Brodega has an acrid bite of sea salt dancing across his skin that is enlivened by a base note of teak, with its crisp, woodsy and somewhat soapy scent.  Floral airs play across the light mixture, their fruity underlying aroma reminiscent of sweet plumeria and pungent ginger, while the refined and warm blend of lemon finishes the misty fragrance.
This scent is eligible for permanence.
The blown glass bottle will cost 200,000 coins.

Encased in a bubble of air, the room appears to be the waterlogged remains of a restaurant's bar.  Water drips from the once polished fixtures, while seaweed rises clings to a marble floor that is similar in color to the oily fronds.  Though no seats remain around the bar, which is crafted of an aquarium that long ago lost all of its denizens, a silver-edged green glass door still bears its bluefin design.
Entry Message: The sound of water being sucked out of a large area fills your ears as your surrounding shifts and the world around you blurs...
Exit Message: The air bubble encasing the room suddenly begins to disintegrate and as a surge of water rushes towards you, your surroundings blur...

raw: A mirage-like haze of arcane influence clings to the jewel, alight with half-glimpsed glyphs refracting across its facets from within.  The effect is dizzying and makes further visual inspection difficult.

Mnemonic:    boldbrawler
Description: Your unarmed combat attacks have an additional 1/2/3/4/5% chance to tier up.
Rarity:      Rare
Mnemonic:    banditbait
Description: Up to 1/2/3 additional bandits will spawn in each group when you are on a bandit task for the Adventurers' Guild.
Rarity:      Legendary
Mnemonic:    arcblade

Description: You enter a heightened state for 30 seconds.  You gain 5/10/15/20/25 Attack Strength and 3/6/9/12/15% Damage Factor, but each attack costs 5 mana and 5 stamina.  Upon activation you gain Mana Sever, preventing you from receiving mana from your fellow adventurers for 2 minutes.
* Activated

items.name: a smooth bone ring pierced by tiny crystal shards

raw: Across the surface of the ring, spots of ochre and brown stains radiate from tiny crystalline structures embedded in the bone.  Ichor green motes and shadows lurk within the crystals, living inclusions that alternately lighten and darken the calcification along the ring's edges.  A faint pulse, deep and bone-jarring, accompanies the flickering, beating like a necrotic heart.
Analysis of a smooth bone ring pierced by tiny crystal shards indicates the creator has provided the following information:
The smooth bone ring is a prize from the Arena of the Abyss (Ebon Gate event).  When worn, it has a chance to summon an undead creature from a recently slain creature.
Attuned: No one
Charges: 0 (ON, PROD to toggle)
Lich's Curse: 0% (ON, TAP to toggle)
Voln's Blessing: 0%
Appearance: ON (COVER to toggle)

Lich's Curse is a % chance for the undead the ring spawns to be a boss creature.  Voln's Blessing is a % chance for the ring owner to receive +15 AS/DS and +10 CS/TD for 30 seconds when they kill the undead the ring spawned.
The ring cannot be altered in any way!
The smooth bone ring will cost 675,000 coins.

items.name: a pure white starsilk wedding gown overlaid with black rose lace skirts

raw: The fabric of the gown is more than merely bright.  It seems to emanate faint light, casting a softly incandescent halo.
It is estimated that a pure white starsilk wedding gown overlaid with black rose lace skirts can store a very small amount with enough space for a couple of items.
Analysis of a pure white starsilk wedding gown overlaid with black rose lace skirts indicates the creator has provided the following information:
A pure white starsilk wedding gown overlaid with black rose lace skirts is a Shadowplay Gown.  It is currently unlocked to Tier 4 of 4.
At Tier 1, the gown will trap LEAN and LOWER.
At Tier 2, the gown gains the ability to shift from light to dark when certain spells are cast at it.  It will also trap CURTSY and TILT.
At Tier 3, it will trap RUB and SPIN.
When fully unlocked to Tier 4, it will trap FOLD and PULL.

When altering this gown, you will need to provide a neutral 15/15/15, a dark 15/15/15, and a light 15/15/15.  The same is true for long descriptions.  If the gown has a look description, it must be appropriate for all three phases and must accompany long descriptions.

When altering these, you can use synonyms for 'shadowy' or 'luminous' as long as they are clearly indicative of the intent (namely that when in light form, they are luminescent/luminous/illuminated, and when they are in dark mode, they are shadowy/shaded).  The neutral form is just like any regular gown alteration.  In all forms, the material and style should remain consistent.
This gown's description can be changed by casting appropriate spells at it.  It can be turned back into its neutral form by using the DUST verb.
The wedding gown will cost 4,000,000 coins.

inv.room_title: A Wing And A Prayer, Above

raw: Slight of frame, but gaunt beyond reason, the sailor marionette has shaggy hair of chestnut yarn brown and a charcoal stubble upon its face.  Rheumy eyes with deep purple lines drawn beneath them give its features a maudlin countenance, and its disheveled clothing only adds to the affect.  Though it is an unkempt and largely dirty marionette, its bare feet seem remarkably clean and manicured.
The marionette can not be worn.
The gaunt sailor marionette will cost 100,000 coins.

Ebon twine weaves through a complicated crossbar of wood that not only supports a half-krolvin bartender marionette but allows it to be manipulated.  Dusky blue skin, a hue somewhere between the sky and the grey of the sea, dominates the segmented arms, which are exposed beneath a white tunic.  Silver-blue hair bristles on end as it stands out from the marionette's head and neck, while matched whiskers trail down the jawline into a braided beard.  Its eyes are fashioned of pewter nodules with cobalt flecks, and deep laugh lines decorate its face.
The marionette can not be worn.
The bartender marionette will cost 100,000 coins.

--LOOK AT ME JEWELRY--
~General Script Information~
This is special jewelry that indicates more precise locations of where and how it is being worn in messaging.

For example, a ring using this script could indicate it was being worn on the left thumb in its worn description.

This ring currently has access to 1 side.
~Alteration Guidelines~
* Alterations to the 15/15/15, long and show of this item can be freely altered.
* This item can have separate descriptions when being worn, as well as when being held.
* Any willing merchant should be able to change the specific position this item can be worn, but not the main area it is worn on.
For example, a ring could be changed to be worn on the left index finger, but NOT be changed to be worn on the wrist.
~Current Settings~
* This item is meant to be worn on a finger, with the specific wear location being on the left ring finger.

Possible specific wear positions for this type of item are: left ring finger, left middle finger, left index finger, left pinky, left thumb, right ring finger, right middle finger, right index finger, right pinky, right thumb.

items.name: a gilt-foiled faenor chatelaine suspending diminutive rose-intaglio jade keys

raw: Designed with practicality in mind, the chatelaine offers both utility and elegance.  Anchored by an embossed hook plate, several finely crafted braided sterling silver chains hold essential tools.  Among them are a mother-of-pearl inlaid scissor sheath and a rose-filigreed silver nail file sheath, ensuring quick access and secure storage.  Dangling from a length of chain is a wren-capped clip that is intended to house a thimble, while a lacquered birch eyeglass case keeps spectacles conveniently within reach.  Additional rings and chains are fashioned to secure a keyring while a small, metallic lobster claw clip is engineered to support a single key.
It is estimated that a gilt-foiled faenor chatelaine suspending diminutive rose-intaglio jade keys can store a fairly small amount with enough space for several items.
Analysis of a gilt-foiled faenor chatelaine suspending diminutive rose-intaglio jade keys indicates the creator has provided the following information:
Fresh from the Coven's Chatelaines.

Designed as both a practical item and a new fashion statement, the chatelaine is a convenient piece of jewelry worn on the waist.  It is crafted from a variety of materials and can be highly customized.
The chatelaine can only hold very specific items and has a maximum capacity of six total items.  It is restricted to holding items with the following nouns:
file, eyeglasses, glasses, key, key ring, scissors, and/or spectacles
Customizations:
Scissor Sheath - a mother-of-pearl inlaid
File Sheath - a rose-filigreed silver
Eyeglass Case - a lacquered birch
Thimble Clip - a wren-capped
Chains - braided sterling silver
Hook Plate - an embossed
Alterations:
* Long Descriptions Only.  It has a stock SHOW.
* Scissor Sheath - You may provide the article and adjective information but it will always be a single scissor sheath.
* File Sheath - You may provide the article and adjective information but it will always be a single file sheath.
* Eyeglass Case - You may provide the article and adjective information but it will always be a single eyeglass case.
* Thimble Clip - You may provide the article and adjective information but it will always be a single thimble clip or clip.
* Chains - These may be plural but will always have a noun of chains.
* Hook Plate - You may provide the article and adjective information but it will always be a single hook plate.
* A gilt-foiled faenor chatelaine suspending diminutive rose-intaglio jade keys cannot be lightened or deepened.
The chatelaine is tier 1 of 2.

raw: The fine fabric of these gloves has an unusual sheen coating the surface.  Imbedded somehow within the weave of the fabric on the back of each hand is a large austere sigil.  The sigil has a slight opalescent cast reminiscent of vaalin, but the actual material remains a mystery.
It is estimated that some trim ink black silk gloves with sigils on the cuffs can store a very small amount with enough space for one item of very small size.
Analysis of some trim ink black silk gloves with sigils on the cuffs indicates the creator has provided the following information:

These gloves are made to be worn by pure magical professions.  They can be altered, but require the sigils to remain intact and the gloves should be made of fabric.  They also have a set show description that can't be removed, but more can be added to it.  The sigils are currently described as austere.  The sigils can be changed, but are limited to a 15 character descriptor.
You can tell that the gloves are as light as they can get, but you might be able to have a talented merchant deepen their pockets for you.
The black silk gloves will cost 5,000,000 coins.

Plainly, a master artisan was responsible for the creation of this silver-sheened mask.  The strong, muscular face is framed in incredibly short seafoam green hair shorn close to the scalp and dotted with bone-white barnacles, which have partially burrowed into the skin.  There are no eyeholes; instead, narrow, white-pupiled ebon eyes are painted upon the mask.  An intricate arcane sigil has been incised just above the wide, flaring nose.
Analysis of a barnacled seafoam green mask indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This is a feature changing mask.  It will temporarily change your features for three hours.  If you look at this mask, you will see how it will change your features.  Once the time is up, it will fall off.  If your hands are both full, it will drop to the ground.  Please make sure that you highlight this mask in some fashion so that you can track it.
This is what it will look like when the mask falls off:
Your facial features slowly grow heavy and seem to harden.  Without warning, something solid and smooth slips from your face and tumbles into your free hand.
The seafoam green mask will cost 200,000 coins.
details.material: organic material, an extremely common material

raw: Sunlight glistens from the silver and deep blue tiles that layer the rooftops of a large city built into the side of a mountain.  Meandering streets weave about in a haphazard fashion.  Centered on one side is a large alabaster keep capped with several high domes, while to the other is a colorful garden surrounded by a series of slender columns.  Crisp bold letters stretch across the top.
Crisp letters stretch across the front of the postcard...
"Greetings from the Shining City!"
Briefly flipping the postcard over, you notice a small space for writing a note.
The postcard can not be worn.
Analysis of a painted Shining City postcard indicates the creator has provided the following information:
~*~ The Papermaker's Postcard ~*~
This postcard was made using the papermaker when it was used in the Shining City.  Once someone WRITES on it, no one else can CLEAN it.
It displays a picture of the area it was created in and will always say "Greetings from the Shining City!"
Due to the size of the postcard, it can't hold any more than 510 characters.
It will always be signed with the author's mark.
It has access to the following verbs: clean, flip, mumble, read, wave, and write
A painted Shining City postcard cannot be altered.
The postcard will cost 5,000 coins.
details.material: organic material, an extremely common material

items.name: a geometrical back pendant of silver revealing a glistening purplish-black tassaet

raw: Analysis of a geometrical back pendant of silver revealing a glistening purplish-black tassaet indicates the creator has provided the following information:
--LOOK AT ME JEWELRY--
~General Script Information~
This is special jewelry that indicates more precise locations of where and how it is being worn in messaging.
It can have a separate description when it is worn, allowing more flexibility in how it looks.
For example, a ring using this script could indicate it was being worn on the left thumb in its worn description.
Each type of jewelry can only be set to specific positions.
Jewelry can have "sides" unlocked to store more designs/specific positions.
This pendant is currently unlocked to: Tier 1 of 2 (OTS)
At this tier, this pendant has access to the verbs: WEAR, REMOVE, WAVE (targeted/untargeted).
This pendant currently has access to 1 side.
~Alteration Guidelines~
* Alterations to the 15/15/15, long and show of this item can be freely altered.
* This item can have separate descriptions when being worn, as well as when being held.
* Any willing merchant should be able to change the specific position this item can be worn, but not the main area it is worn on.
For example, a ring could be changed to be worn on the left index finger, but NOT be changed to be worn on the wrist.
~Current Settings~
* This item is meant to be worn around the neck, with the specific wear location being on the neck (loose fit).
Possible specific wear positions for this type of item are: loose fit, tight fit/choker.
* Unworn 15/15/15: a geometrical,silver,pendant
* Unworn Long Description: a geometrical back pendant of silver revealing a glistening purplish-black tassaet
* Worn 15/15/15: a geometrical,silver,pendant
* Worn Long Description: a geometrical back pendant of silver revealing a glistening purplish-black tassaet worn loosely around the neck [Default]
The silver pendant will cost 20,000 coins.

The incarnadine gown is fully alterable with the following restrictions:
1.  Must be corseted
2.  Must fall below the knee
3.  Must be fitted
It has been unlocked to Tier 3 and traps TURN, PUSH, PULL, TOUCH, SIT, STAND, EXHALE, BREATHE, ATTEND, RUB, WEAR, REMOVE, KICK, RAISE.

Several dark, deep purple prismatic spears radiate outward from a central point in each hairjewel to form this crown-like collection of amethyst crystals.  Each spear shows the deepest color in its interior, fading gradually to clear crystal on the outer edges.  A setting of silver encases the jewels, with delicate braided strands of silver connecting each one to create a web-like appearance over the hair when worn.
Analysis of some silver-set amethyst hairjewels indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is a hair accessory.  It can be altered with a show, but should not be given a long description.  The item should remain hairjewels, beads, hairbeads, or something else plural of this nature.
You can PUSH, PULL, TURN, and NUDGE to choose different styles.
The amethyst hairjewels will cost 150,000 coins.

A simply woven headband of sea blue mermaid roses has been worked on by an item from the Weave a Little Dream of Me Collection I series.  As a result, it has additional actions it can do that the average woven item can't.  They are:
Bow, Curtsy, Remove, Twist, and Wear.

The woven headband will cost 25,000 coins.

raw: There appears to be something written on it.
In the Common language, it reads:
Scion of Neartofar
The bottle can not be worn.
Analysis of a resaeun-framed cypress green glass bottle indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This bottle is for perfume or cologne.  Current verbs are: DRINK, MEASURE, POUR, and SMELL.
When applied, this bottle will produce the following scent.

First-person: You have the heavy notes of smoky and sweet cypress chasing the biting, stringent aroma of forest-found herbs, the hawthorn and elderberry framed by the ancient, regal wood.  Soothing lavender melds with the restorative scent of fresh cedar, the notes wrapped in a sophisticated bed of warm musk chased with powdery vanilla.

Third-person: Brodega has the heavy notes of smoky and sweet cypress chasing the biting, stringent aroma of forest-found herbs, the hawthorn and elderberry framed by the ancient, regal wood.  Soothing lavender melds with the restorative scent of fresh cedar, the notes wrapped in a sophisticated bed of warm musk chased with powdery vanilla.
This scent is eligible for permanence.
The cypress green bottle will cost 10,000 coins.

raw: Analysis of a vellum-caged pomander cradling dried nightshade petals indicates the creator has provided the following information:
The 15/15/15 base of the pomander/fan can be altered, but the noun must remain 'pomander' or 'fan' and the adjective must be one of the following:

Acipha, acistira, aelerine, almond blossom, amaryllis, amaranth, angelica, apple blossom,  apricot blossom, arisaema, begonia, beleria, bleeding-heart, bluebells, buttercup, butterflyweed, camellia, canver blossom, carnation, cherry blossom, chrysanthemum, clematis, clivia, cothinar flower, crocus, daenys, daffodil, dahlia, daisy, datura, dragonstalk, e'naso, echinacea, flamestalk, freesia, gardenia, ginger blossom, goldenrod, heather, hellebore, heliotrope, hibiscus, hollyhock, honeysuckle, Imaera's Lace, irikaen, iris, laurel, lavender, lelelyia, lemon blossom, lilac, lily, lunaria, jabuticaba flower, jasmine, jessamine, magnolia, milkweed, mereviolet, monkeyflower, moonflower, moonspike, mournbloom, mugwort, naefira, Nalfein ivy, nightshade, orange blossom, orchid, passionflower, peach blossom, pear blossom, phlox, plum blossom, plumeria, poppy, rose, sea holly, snapdragon, snowdrop, starspire, sunflower, taerethil, teapot lotus, thilban, tulip, violet, yinmai, or zinnia.
The available verbs for this pomander/fan are WAVE and SMELL.
The nightshade pomander will cost 50,000 coins.
details.material: organic material, an extremely common material

sign: Written on an etched stained glass sign:
Please LOOK closely, many items have small details!
The wig will change your hair.
The carnation, orchids and blue-tinted rose are worn behind the ear.
The basket is a picnic basket.

raw: Analysis of a filigreed white gold torc indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is a crystal amulet holder with a light theme.
Any merchant may freely alter the appearance of the item, provided it remains a jewelry-like item consistent with the location where it can be worn, and it logically can hold a crystal amulet.
This is fully unlocked.  You could WEAR, REMOVE, RUB, CLENCH, GAZE, KISS, PEER, POKE, PUSH, PULL, RAISE, SPIN, TAP, TICKLE, TOUCH, AND TURN the torc.
The white gold torc will cost 50,000 coins.

items.name: a rope-chained silver necklace strung with a blue-sheened opaque moon jellyfish pendant

raw: Analysis of a rope-chained silver necklace strung with a blue-sheened opaque moon jellyfish pendant indicates the creator has provided the following information:
Part of the "I Dream of Geology" series out of the Isle of Ornath, the necklace has access to the following verbs: eat, fidget, pinch, remove, twist, and wear.
Alteration Instructions:  You may alter freely, but it must remain metal of some kind of necklace and have a chain.
The silver necklace will cost 35,000 coins.

items.name: a choker of blue cowrie shells

raw: Tiers of tiny blue cowrie shells have been strung on slender silver wire, forming the body of this simple, delicate choker.  At the center lies a single coquina shell, striped with bands of dark violet that begin at the shell's point and widen out as they reach the shell's edge.  A small tag reads, "Property of Ogalesh."
Analysis of a choker of blue cowrie shells indicates the item is free from merchant alteration restrictions.
The blue cowrie shells will cost 65,000 coins.

Suspended from a twisted serpentine silver chain, the rowan pendant is carved into a soaring falcon with tapered scythe-like wings.  A thin layer of dark lacquer has been carefully applied to the scored wings, back, and head of the bird, creating a variegated dappled pattern on the otherwise pale wood.  Two tiny spots of jade inlay serve as eyes.
Analysis of a carved rowan falcon pendant indicates the item is free from merchant alteration restrictions.
The rowan falcon pendant will cost 65,000 coins.

items.name: a simply woven circlet of smooth jet crows and slender pallid silver wires

raw: The woven circlet has 10 things woven into it, among which you see several smooth jet crows and several slender pallid silver wires.
Analysis of a simply woven circlet of smooth jet crows and slender pallid silver wires indicates the creator has provided the following information:

A simply woven circlet of smooth jet crows and slender pallid silver wires has been worked on by an item from the Weave a Little Dream of Me Collection I series.  As a result, it has additional actions it can do that the average woven item can't.  They are:
Bow, Curtsy, Remove, Twist, and Wear.
You may have a merchant customize a hairstyle on the circlet.
You can add a scent to it by pouring perfume on it.
The woven circlet will cost 15,000 coins.

Order of the Lorekeepers
Snowflake Carnival, 5108

rub
